text: I have a menu set up but for some reason, the dropdown flyouts work fine on this page <http://www.moonoia.com/db-become-a-partner> but wont work on this page <http://www.moonoia.com/db-partners>  unless clicked, tehy different templates using the same header its so strange

Heya <@UFZ869C9W>, it's working on the first page because there's a bunch of CSS from vast-style.css included. You'll either need to add those declarations to the other page, or attach that stylesheet.
anyone else keep running into the issue in the design manager today?
they were just starting work on their mobile view that was requested today. :joy:  (kidding) I haven’t seen that yet but that definitely doesn’t look fun
not to be captain obvious but try `cmd/cntrl` + `shift` + `r`
some combination of modules i had didn’t like it when i hit “edit global and smart content”
so i just undid what i did and its working now
ahh
yeah that smart content thing I don’t think is supposed to actually work for custom modules, discovered it the other day
like I think it’s something that’s supposed to be hidden for a beta
Heya <@U7BQUDTEJ>, could you shoot me a link to this module? I'll clone it and see if I can tell what's up :slightly_smiling_face:
yeah let me see i can get it to happen again
Thanks Michelle maybe it was a caching thing but I tried this, and it worked, but its also adding a bunch of styles breaking other areas, at least on right track :slightly_smiling_face:

Hey all, thought I’d post this here in case anybody knows some freelancers or partners to suggest for this user:
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Looking-for-Developer/m-p/255274>

If someone would like to response please feel free to do so, otherwise I’ll be pointing her to upwork/partner directory or somewhere else! Thank you

bit of a pain-point

It appears copying a folder, or multiple folders and their contents from 1 portal to another is not easily possible.
<https://spin.d.pr/YY87JF+>
for anyone experiencing this problem i kinda have a simple workaround to this. create a template that contains all of your modules. move that one template to a new portal and voila
it carries over those modules
<@U7SL518D6> have you tried FTPing from one portal to another? would that work?
I didn’t, thought about it, but I figured copy to portal is a safer method
Just noticed this but are custom modules not allowed to be made for coded email templates anymore?
<@UAQHN1F2Q> not sure why you’re seeing that but yes you can still create modules that are allowed in email templates
<https://spin.d.pr/1wPhAx+>
dark theme off :wink:

hmm, odd... maybe i gotta clear my cache or something, unrelated but <@U7SL518D6>, i've seen you use that `<https://spin.d.pr>` url for quick screen records as well, what program/site are you using for that?
<https://droplr.com/> perhaps
droplr. It’s hands down the best screen recording/screen shotting tool
better than skitch?
haven’t really used skitch just tried it on someone elses computer. but the user experience is exactly how you want it to be
i guess i can do screen recordings with skitch
cant rather
i no longer use evernote which is why i started using skitch

nifty, thank you.
been trying to find an alternative to some screen recorders that just haven't met the mark.
basically think evernote+ easy screenshotting and annotating, URL Shortening(with custom domains) , code snippet sharing, plain text sharing, gif making, video screenshare making. all in one tool
and it’s one of those tools that just works.

And HubSpot support for the answer:
Looks like this client's portal is only on the `Marketing Hub Starter` plan and to get custom modules for email templates it needs to be a higher tier...
odd how in the pricing tiers I can't find any information stating this..., nor in the docs about creating custom modules
